task_description: Facing the building to your North-West (approx. 322°), estimate the height of the main building in front of you in meters. Answer with one number and a short rationale.

reason: I need to estimate the height of the building, but I can't see the top, so I will look up to get a better view of the entire structure.
I still cannot see the top of the building, so I need to tilt my view further upwards to see the roofline.
I have tilted up twice but still cannot see the top of the building; I will tilt up again to see the roof.
I can now see the top and bottom of the building; by counting the floors (approximately 10) and assuming a standard floor height of 3.5 meters, I can estimate the total height to be around 35 meters.
